author: Special Correspondent
text:
Four students of Indian Institute of Information Technology (IIIT), functioning at the Bharathidasan Institute of Technology (BIT) campus of the Anna University-Tiruchi, began an indefinite fast on Saturday.

Students of IIIT have been demanding change of the mentor institute. They have also demanding better amenities and faculty members on a par with premier Central government institute like Indian Institute of Technology.

V.S.S. Karthick, P. Omkar, K. Pavanteja and A. Harish started the fast at the early hours.

Karthick said that they would continue the fast until they received order from the Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD) on changing the mentorship.

Meanwhile, the dharna of other students entered fourth day on Saturday. They have been sitting in front of the campus.

S. Madhumathi, Director of Technical Education, and K.S. Palanisamy, Collector, visited the agitating students and held talks with them on Thursday. However, the students refused to withdraw the agitation without written assurance from the Central government.
title: IIIT students begin indefinite strike
